intro: Hanslia, commonly known as the "bluebell of the Andes," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae. These plants are native to South America, particularly the Andean regions of Peru and Ecuador. Hanslia species are typically herbaceous, with striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the spring.
